title: Theme Settings: Instructions

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: PAGES tab in menu.

fields.label: Adding Pages
fields.message:
1. Enter Title.
  2. Pick a Page Template: The template determines the visual layout for your new page. If you are unsure of the template to use, view an existing page in which you would like the new page to mimic. Below are the available templates:
    • a. General Content: General content such as in the About page layout
    • b. Homepage Content: Home page layout
    • c. Main Category Content: Programs page layout
    • d. Program Landing Content: Individual Program page layout
    • There are additional page templates available in the dropdown menu. These are templates used by different parts of the website and should not be used for new pages.
  3. Enter Content.
  4. Enter SEO Content: SEO content can be added in the Yoast SEO tab of the admin.
    • a. Focus Keyphrase: Enter the word or phrase that best describes what the page content is about.
    • b. Title: This should consist of the main topic of the page (Usually the main heading of the page) in addition to CARE of Southeastern Michigan.
    • c. Meta Description: This is a succinct sentence that summarizes what the page is about.
  5. Preview Page: Preview the page appearance before it goes live.
  6. Save Draft: Save the page as a draft until published.
  7. Publish: Publish the page to go live/public on your website.
  8. Add Link to Main Navigation:
    • a. Go to the APPEARANCE > MENU tab.
    • b. Select the menu to edit in dropdown.
    • c. Choose Page to Add: The new page automatically appears at the bottom of the navigation list.
    • d. Drag page into the desired order.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: TIMELINE EXPRESS tab in menu.

fields.label: Adding to the History Page Timeline
fields.message: 1. Adding History Milestone: Milestones are labeled as Announcements. Click on New Announcement in order to add a milestone.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message:
TESTIMONIALS tab in menu. These posts appear in two areas:

  1. Short Testimonial Quotes: Integrated into page content
  2. Success Stories: Integrated into the Success Stories area

fields.label: Adding Testimonial Posts
fields.message:
1. Enter Title.
  2. Pick a Content Category(s): It is important to choose a relevant content category for each post since this will determine where the post will appear throughout the website.
  3. Pick Success Story Category if Applicable: This is relevant only for the longer, case study testimonials that will appear in the Success Stories Page.
  4. Enter Content:
    • a. Short Testimonial Quotes: The only required fields for this post are the fields located in the Testimonial tab of the content admin.
    • b. If nothing is inputted into the Introduction > Image field, the Default Testimonial Image will appear.
  5. Preview Page: Preview the post appearance before it goes live.
  6. Save Draft: Save the post as a draft until published.
  7. Publish: Publish the post to go live/public on your website.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: POSTS tab in menu.

fields.label: Adding News Posts
fields.message:
1. Enter Title.
  2. Pick a Content Category(s): It is important to choose a relevant content category for each post since this will determine where the post will appear throughout the website.
  3. Enter Content:
    • a. If nothing is inputted into the Introduction > Image field, the Default Blog Image will appear.
  4. Preview Page: Preview the post appearance before it goes live.
  5. Save Draft: Save the post as a draft until published.
  6. Publish: Publish the post to go live/public on your website.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: EVENTS tab in menu.

fields.label: Adding Calendar Posts
fields.message:
1. Enter Title.
  2. Pick a Content Category(s): It is important to choose a relevant content category for each post since this will determine where the post will appear throughout the website.
  3. Pick a Calendar Category(s): (Ex. Signature Events, Events, Classes & Groups, Training) It is important to choose a calendar category for each post since this will determine where the post will appear throughout the website.
  4. Enter Content.
  5. Events: Additional Fields:
    • a. Max Number Registrations: Type in the number of maximum participants. Default is 50.
    • b. Current Number Registrations: This number calculates automatically. This is the current number of registrations based on the number of form submissions.
    • c. Main Image: This image is the main image that will represent the post. If no image is chosen, the default image will appear.
  6. Events: Additional Fields – Form ID:
    • a. If there is a form associated with the post, make sure to fill out the Registration Form field with the appropriate form ID.
    • b. To find the appropriate form ID, the form has to have already been created in the Form admin.
    • c. Fill out the field:
      • i. Go to the main content editor for the post (Content editor below post title).
      • ii. Click Add form.
      • iii. Select the appropriate form from the form dropdown.
      • iv. Copy and cut the line that appears in the editor. It should be something similar to [gravityform id="17" title="true" description="true"].
      • v. Paste this line into the Registration Form field.
  7. Preview Page: Preview the post appearance before it goes live.
  8. Save Draft: Save the post as a draft until published.
  9. Publish: Publish the post to go live/public on your website.

fields.label: Signature Events
fields.message: There are landing pages for each of the signature events (Subpages under Events & Calendar > Signature Events tab). Whenever a calendar post is created for any of the signature events, make sure to add a post link in the relevant Signature Event subpage.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: FORMS tab in menu.

fields.label: Adding Forms
fields.message:
1. New Form: Either add new form or duplicate an existing form template.
  2. Enter Content: Drag and drop desired fields from right-hand side field groups.
  3. Update Form: Save form.
  4. Form ID: Each form will have a unique ID visible in the ID column of the form list view.

fields.label: Adding Forms: Settings
fields.message:
1. Form Settings:
    • a. Form Title: You can edit the form title here.
    • b. Save and Continue: Check the box for Enable Save and Continue.
  2. Confirmations:
    • a. Default Confirmation: In order to set a Thank You page, select Page in the Confirmation Type options.
    • b. A new Thank You page should be created per each unique page/calendar post. You can reuse a Thank You page if it was previously used for the same page/calendar post.
  3. Notifications:
    • a. Form inquiries will go to the email addresses set in the Send to Email field.
    • b. From Email: This will be the email address forms will be sent from.
  4. MailChimp: Choose the email audience segment you would like inquiries to filter into using the MailChimp List dropdown.
  5. Testing:
    • a. Always test forms to make sure data is being captured and notifications are being sent correctly.
    • b. Preview: You can always preview a form before going live using the Preview tab.

fields.label: Reviewing Form Data
fields.message: You can review all form data entries using the Entries tab in the form admin.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: THEME SETTINGS tab in menu.

fields.label: Managing Theme Settings
fields.message: This area is where all general settings are set for the website. If there is content that is set universally throughout all site pages (ex. footer content), the content is most likely edited in this area.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: MEDIA tab in menu.

fields.label: Managing Media
fields.message:
• Naming Assets for Web:
    1. Create SEO Optimized Titles (maintopic-subtopic-01.jpg).
    2. Reference keywords for the page (What are the page search terms?).
    3. Sequence of the words should make sense logically. Typically the first word is the most important.
  • Alt Tags:
    1. Should be relatively the same as file name.
    2. These should contain simple descriptions of the image and include a target keyphrase when relevant.

fields.label: Admin
fields.message: USERS tab in menu.

fields.label: Managing Users
fields.message:
1. Administrators have access to all the administration features.
  2. Editors can publish posts, manage posts as well as manage other people’s posts, etc.
  3. Authors can publish and manage their own posts, and are able to upload files.
  4. Contributors can write and manage their posts but not publish posts or upload media files.
  5. Subscribers can read comments/comment/receive newsletters, etc. but cannot create regular site content.

description: General Instructions for Content Integration into the CARE website.
